definitions.definition: To publicly make known one's views, contributions, or vote, especially in a contentious situation where fortitude is required.
To take significant individual action to help a group effort.
(Euphemistic form of) God.

An alleged force or natural power, supposed, by Carl Reichenbach and others, to produce the phenomena of mesmerism, and to be developed by various agencies, as by magnets, heat, light, chemical or vital action, etc.
A sudden or complete loss of courage and firmness in the face of trouble or danger; overwhelming and disabling terror; a sinking of the spirits
definitions.example: He looked in dismay at the destruction of the town caused by the hurricane.

definitions.definition: Condition fitted to dismay; ruin.
To cause to feel apprehension; great sadness, or fear; to deprive of energy
To render lifeless; to subdue; to disquiet.
To take dismay or fright; to be filled with dismay.
The most common chess piece, or a similar piece in a similar game. In chess each side has eight; moves are only forward, and attacks are only forward diagonally or en passant.
Someone who is being manipulated or used to some end.
definitions.example: Though a pawn of the gods, her departure is the precipitating cause of the Trojan War.

definitions.definition: The state of being held as security for a loan, or as a pledge.
definitions.example: All our jewellery was in pawn by this stage.

definitions.definition: An instance of pawning something.
An item given as security on a loan, or as a pledge.
A pawnshop; pawnbroker.
To pledge; to stake or wager.
To give as security on a loan of money; especially, to deposit (something) at a pawn shop.
A psychoactive preparation of betel leaf combined with areca nut and/or cured tobacco, chewed recreationally in Asia; such a preparation served wrapped in the leaf.
A gallery.
(originally leet) To own, to defeat or dominate (someone or something, especially a game or someone playing a game).
The action of ruffling or setting in disorder.
To put into disorder; to tumble; to touse; to muss.
A garden or an area of land for the cultivation of fruit or nut trees.
The trees themselves cultivated in such an area.
A mix of discordant sounds; dissonance.
An animal belonging to the subphylum Inarticulata.
(of speech) not articulated in normal words
Speechless
Unable to speak with any clarity
Not having joints or other articulations
Powdered spice made from dried and ground fruits of sweet pepper (bell pepper) or chili pepper (cultivars of Capsicum annuum), or mixtures of these (used especially in Hungarian cooking).
A variety of the spice.
(rare, commonly called "dried [bell/chilli] peppers" or "dried capsicums") A dried but not yet ground fruit of sweet pepper (bell pepper) or chili pepper sold for use as a spice.
A bright reddish orange colour resembling that of the ground spice.
Of a bright reddish orange colour, like that of the dried paprika.
An informal social gathering, usually in a natural outdoor setting, to which the participants bring their own food and drink.
definitions.example: We went out for a picnic in the forest.

definitions.definition: The meal eaten at such a gathering.
An easy or pleasant task.
definitions.example: We remind the guests that dealing with this problem is no picnic, and to be patient.

definitions.definition: An entertainment at which each person contributed some dish to a common table.
To take part in a picnic.
Flared riding trousers of heavy cloth, fitting tightly from knee to ankle.
(often as a term of address) A person who is much loved.
A sweetheart.
A fruit that is a crossbreed between a grapefruit and a pomelo, originating in Israel.
A sweet.
definitions.example: Can I have a box of sweeties for being a good boy?

definitions.definition: A newspaper or magazine with many pictures, or section thereof
An article primarily featuring many photographs, or simply a collection of photographs
A stamp featuring a vignette of local scenery or culture.
Of, relating to, composed of, or illustrated by pictures.
Described or otherwise represented as if in a picture; graphic or vivid.
Stylistically similar to a painting, especially following pictorial conventions (of a photograph) – see pictorialism.
One who uses body strength instead of intellectual power to earn a wage, usually hourly.
A wedding in which the bride is already pregnant.
Any similarly reputedly forced partnership, between people or organizations.
A player who stands behind the batsman’s wicket ready to catch the ball, or to stump the batsman.
Inflammation of the liver, sometimes caused by a viral infection.
To regress; to slip backwards or revert to a previous, worse state.
definitions.example: He felt better for a little while, before his condition started to backslide.

definitions.definition: To shirk responsibility; to renege on one's obligations or commitments.
definitions.example: Rich countries are backsliding on their commitment to agree to new WTO measures to help people in poor countries gain access to affordable medicines. — Oxfam press release, 24 June 2002

definitions.definition: An occasion on which one backslides, especially in a moral sense
Sliding back
A Japanese martial art developed from jujitsu and making use of holds and throws.
A school of the martial art.
A distorted facial expression.
To make a grotesque or funny face.
The outdoor game bowls.
A bank or side of a river.
definitions.example: Gonna lay down my burden; Down by the riverside...

definitions.definition: At or near the side of a river.
An organism whose genome has been genetically modified.
Of, or pertaining to an organism whose genome has been changed by the addition of a gene from another species; (of an organism) whose genome has been changed by such addition, genetically modified.
Of or pertaining to sociology.
A female freshman.
The top surface of a counter, for preparation of food etc.
The retail facility whereby a customer may withdraw an amount of cash when making a purchase with a credit card or debit card, the amount being added to the bill.
An undertaker's room where the body of the deceased is kept prior to burial or disposal.
In a parliamentary democracy, the chief member of the cabinet and head of the government; often the leader of the majority party.
definitions.example: This is a list of all prime ministers since Churchill.

definitions.definition: A small, typically rectangular or round, flat, and rigid object upon which things are carried.
definitions.example: I carefully arranged the dishes on the tray and brought it upstairs.

definitions.definition: A flat carrier for items being transported.
definitions.example: Make sure that tray of eggs is properly loaded.

definitions.definition: The items on a full tray.
definitions.example: Before long they had consumed a whole tray of shrimp cocktails and sent for another.

definitions.definition: A component of a device into which an item is placed for use in the device's operations.
definitions.example: The CD tray will not open.

definitions.definition: A notification area used for icons and alerts.
A type of retail or wholesale packaging for CPUs where the processors are sold in bulk and/or with minimal packaging.
(pickup) truck bed
To place (items) on a tray
definitions.example: Be sure to tray eggs with the large end up.

definitions.definition: To slide down a snow-covered hill on a tray from a cafeteria.
definitions.example: Traying has provided collegiate fun and the occasional fatality for decades.

definitions.definition: Trouble; annoyance; anger
To grieve; to annoy
To betray
A playing card or die with the rank of three.
A score of three in cards, dice, or dominoes.
A three-pointer.
The third bearer of the same personal name in a family, often denoted by suffixed Roman numeral III.
The third branch of a deer's antler.
Any coniferous tree of the genus Pinus.
definitions.example: The northern slopes were covered mainly in pine.

definitions.definition: Any tree (usually coniferous) which resembles a member of this genus in some respect.
The wood of this tree.
(obsolete except South Africa) A pineapple.
A painful longing.
To languish; to lose flesh or wear away through distress.
To long, to yearn so much that it causes suffering.
definitions.example: Laura was pining for Bill all the time he was gone.

definitions.definition: To grieve or mourn for.
To inflict pain upon; to torment.
A traditional form of Mexican music, either sung or purely instrumental.
A group that plays mariachi music.
A member of such a group.
Of or pertaining to a traditional form of Mexican music, either sung or purely instrumental.
Of or pertaining to a band playing such music, or to the singers of such songs.
A grid of parallel metal bars designed as an obstacle to prevent hooved animals from passing.
An impetuous and reckless person who is difficult to control; a hothead.
Penalty kick
A blend of chilis, tamarind, ginger, cumin, and mustard seeds, originally from Goa.
A hot curry made with this spice.
Becoming very vocal or even violent when angered or frustrated.
An enclosure for children to play in.
A parallelogram having all sides of equal length.
In early Greek religion, an instrument whirled on the end of a string similar to a bullroarer.
Any of several flatfishes, including the brill and turbot, once considered part of the genus Rhombus, now in Scophthalmus.
Snails, now in genus Conus or family Conidae.
A vile, wicked person.
In fiction, a character who has the role of being bad, especially antagonizing the hero.
Any opponent player, especially a hypothetical player for example and didactic purposes. Compare: hero.
definitions.example: Let's discuss how to play if you are the chip leader (that is, if you have more chips than all the villains).

definitions.definition: To debase; to degrade.
A feudal tenant.
A large bird of prey, Aquila chrysaetos, that hunts while soaring.
Paid absence from work specifically to recover from illness.
A female school principal.
A type of fruit, of orange colour, very sweet, quite astringent when immature.
The tree this fruit grows on, generally one of two species of ebony: Diospyros kaki (Asian) or Diospyros virginiana (North American).
An estimation of something's worth.
The process of estimating the value of a financial asset or liability.

(propositional logic, model theory) An assignment of truth values to propositional variables, with a corresponding assignment of truth values to all propositional formulas with those variables (obtained through the recursive application of truth-valued functions corresponding to the logical connectives making up those formulas).
(first-order logic, model theory) A structure, and the corresponding assignment of a truth value to each sentence in the language for that structure.
A measure of size or multiplicity.
(measure theory, domain theory) A map from the class of open sets of a topological space to the set of positive real numbers including infinity.

A typically Middle Eastern and South Asian cultural practice whereby a family member, usually female, is murdered by other family members, the act being justified as retribution for a (usually sexual) slight upon the family's honour.
(of animals, lovers, etc) To touch someone or something with the nose.
definitions.example: She nuzzled her boyfriend in the cinema.

definitions.definition: To nurse; to foster; to bring up.
To nestle; to house, as in a nest.
To go along with the nose to the ground, like a pig.
An overlarge page that is folded into a book or magazine; a foldout
The absence of harmony or concordance.
A person who practices homeopathy.
A temporary loss of consciousness.
A temporary loss of memory.
An instance of censorship, especially a temporary one.
definitions.example: media blackout

definitions.definition: A large-scale power failure, and resulting loss of electricity to consumers.
definitions.example: "The repairs at the Koeberg Power Station in the Western Cape were on schedule for completion in the third week of May. This follows huge blackouts related to the problems at the power supplier since November. Weekend Argus May 13/14 2006 p.5.

definitions.definition: The mandatory blocking of all light emanating from buildings as imposed during World War II.
A sunfish.
(of weather or a day) Featuring a lot of sunshine.
definitions.example: Whilst it may be sunny today, the weather forecast is predicting rain.

definitions.definition: (of a place) Receiving a lot of sunshine.
definitions.example: I would describe Spain as sunny, but it's nothing in comparison to the Sahara.

definitions.definition: (of a person or a person's mood) cheerful
definitions.example: a sunny disposition

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the sun; proceeding from, or resembling the sun; shiny; radiant.
Sunny side up
Any of various large insects of the order Mantodea that catch insects or other small animals with their powerful forelegs.
A green colour, like that of many mantises.
A person who is or tries to be excessively proper, especially one who is easily offended by matters of a sexual nature.
Prudish.
Anything that clips.
(chiefly in the plural) A tool used for clipping something, such as hair, coins, or fingernails.
Something that moves swiftly; especially:
The Asian butterfly Parthenos sylvia, family Nymphalidae.
A circuit which prevents the amplitude of a wave from exceeding a set value.
A person who mutilates coins by fraudulently paring the edges.
Confidence trickster; conman.
A continuous flexible band moved by a series of rollers to transport objects or material from one place to another, especially within a factory or mine.
Banking carried out over a computer network.
Someone who plays a trumpet.
Any of three species of bird in the family Psophiidae from South America named for the trumpeting threat call of the males.
Any of a number of breeds of fancy pigeon (variety of domestic pigeon (Columba livia), originally bred for their peculiar gurgling voice, a prolonged coo called "trumpeting" or "drumming").
One who proclaims, publishes, or denounces.
An American swan (Cygnus buccinator) with a very loud honk.
A perciform fish of the family Latridae, native to Australia, New Zealand and Chile.
An elderly person who regularly uses the Internet.
To skate on ice, wearing ice skates
definitions.example: She had ice-skated the entire lake.

definitions.definition: Certain insects
Certain fish
Anything displayed for show.
To wave or flutter smartly in the wind.
To parade, display with ostentation.
definitions.example: She's always flaunting her designer clothes.

definitions.definition: To show off, as with flashy clothing.
To flout.

A fine granular substance produced in flowers. Technically a collective term for pollen grains (microspores) produced in the anthers of flowering plants. (This specific usage dating from mid 18th century.)
Fine powder in general, fine flour. (16th-century usage documented by the OED.)
definitions.example: "...and ther was good wyne of Gascoyne,... as well of pollen, as of other vitailes..." Froissart, Jean, 1338?-1410?; Berners, John Bourchier, Lord https//archive.org/details/chroniclefroiss00froigoog

definitions.definition: To cover with, or as if with, pollen.
A woman present at the christening of a baby who promises to help raise the child in a Christian manner; a female godparent who sponsors the baptism of a child.
To act as godmother to.

An open, outdoor theatre (which may be a theatre in the round, or have a stage with seating on only one side), especially one from the classical period of ancient Greece or Rome, or a modern venue of similar design.
definitions.example: Ancient Roman amphitheatres were mostly oval or circular in plan, with seating tiers that surrounded the central performance area, like a modern open-air stadium.

definitions.definition: A natural formation of a similar shape, where a steep mountain or slope a particular rock formation forms a partial or compete bowl, especially one used as a performance space (and possibly modified by carving out seats, etc) because the slopes naturally amplify or echo sound.
Something twisted, intertwined, or curled.
definitions.example: a wreath of smoke;  a wreath of clouds

definitions.definition: An ornamental circular band made, for example, of plaited flowers and leaves, and used as decoration; a garland or chaplet, especially one given to a victor.

An appendage to the shield, placed above it, and supporting the crest; an orle, a torse. It generally represents a twist of two cords of silk, one tinctured like the principal metal, the other like the principal color in the coat of arms.
A defect in glass.
To place an entwined circle of flowers upon or around something.
To wrap around something in a circle.
definitions.example: At the funeral, a circle of comrades wreathed the grave of the honored deceased.

definitions.definition: To curl, writhe or spiral in the form of a wreath.
Having narrow views on moral matters; prudish.
Bound with stays.
Not elected
A joining together of minds or spirits.
Holy Communion
A form of ecclesiastical unity between the Roman Church and another, so that the latter is considered part of the former.
A voluntary self-imposed punishment for a sinful act or wrongdoing. It may be intended to serve as reparation for the act.
A sacrament in some Christian churches.
Any instrument of self-punishment.
Repentance
Pain; sorrow; suffering
To impose penance; to punish.

A union similar to marriage which same-sex couples, and in some jurisdictions opposite-sex couples, may form, which affords rights and responsibilities similar or identical to those afforded by civil marriage.
An edible univalve mollusc of the genus Haliotis, having a shell lined with mother-of-pearl.
The meat of the aforementioned mollusc.
A system of training to improve the memory.
A memory card game in which a pack of cards is spread out face down and players try to turn up pairs with the same symbol.
A container for frying food.
A young chicken suitable for frying; a pullet
(of lines or paths) To run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
(of interests, opinions, or anything else) To become different; to run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
definitions.example: Both stories start out the same way, but they diverge halfway through.

definitions.definition: (of a line or path) To separate, to tend into a different direction (from another line or path).
definitions.example: The sidewalk runs next to the street for a few miles, then diverges from it and turns north.

definitions.definition: (of an interest, opinion, or anything else) To become different, to separate (from another line or path).
definitions.example: The software is pretty good, except for a few cases where its behavior diverges from user expectations.

definitions.definition: (of a sequence, series, or function) Not to converge: to have no limit, or no finite limit.
(law enforcement) Any police organization; a constabulary.
definitions.example: He joined the police force a long time ago, when he lived in Virginia.

definitions.definition: (urology) To pass urine from the body.
The normal oxide of carbon, CO₂; a colorless, odorless gas formed during respiration and combustion and consumed by plants during photosynthesis.
